http://stackoverflow.com/a/17946727

It's the font ... GE SS Two display the letters in Hindi. If you change the font from the inspector you will get the Arabic numbers (the one we call English)
http://www.fonts2u.com/ge-ss-two-bold.font

On a side note, GE SS Two costs $6800 USD (attaching the price quotation for the font that we got when we tried to buy its license from the author) and I see people use it every now and then freely! Even worse this website belongs to the Ministry of Trade and Industry I can tell 100% that they didn't pay for it.
Designers use font freely without thinking of the consequences, your buisness could get hurt if you don't pay for the license of the font you use.
الارقام الهنديه مش هى الأرقام بتاعتنا
لو عايزه يظهر بالارقام العربي مهما كان الفونت .. دي الطريقة php

I will write in English to enforce the right layout.

The characters representing non-localized numbers fall in the range \u0030 - \u0039. How they are displayed will be different depending on the client machine locale. If you want to enforce the indic representation of numbers, you can use their indexes in unicode \u0660 - \u0669. Just write a function in PHP to search for these characters & replace them.

You must make sure that the font that you are using supports these characters in the first place, or it will appear as empty boxes.
